document_title: HELLP syndrome: Causes, signs and prevention
subsection_content: The method of intervention for postpartum HELLP syndrome is to terminate the pregnancy and quickly remove the fetus from the uterus. Stabilize blood pressure if any, and other manifestations of HELLP such as seizures and DIC as well as monitor the fetus. Most cases recover completely within 24 - 48 hours or within 5 days after giving birth, however in some cases symptoms can last up to 14 days.
subsection_data:
hoi chung hellp.json. Treatments
The method of intervention for postpartum HELLP syndrome is to terminate the pregnancy and quickly remove the fetus from the uterus. Stabilize blood pressure if any, and other manifestations of HELLP such as seizures and DIC as well as monitor the fetus. Most cases recover completely within 24 - 48 hours or within 5 days after giving birth, however in some cases symptoms can last up to 14 days.
